meanings.definition: Requiring or showing great effort or energy
meanings.sent1: The hike up the steep mountain was very strenuous.
meanings.sent2: She found the strenuous workout challenging but rewarding.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle all those balls while riding a unicycle was a strenuous task.
meanings.sent4: The marathon was a strenuous test of endurance for the runners.
meanings.sent5: The construction workers faced a strenuous day under the scorching sun.

meanings.definition: Characterized by vigorous activity or exertion
meanings.sent1: The dance routine was so strenuous that she was out of breath.
meanings.sent2: The athletes engaged in a strenuous training session to prepare for the competition.
meanings.sent3: The puppies' playtime turned into a strenuous chase around the yard.
meanings.sent4: The storm brought a strenuous wind that shook the trees violently.
meanings.sent5: The factory workers had to keep up with the strenuous pace of the assembly line.

meanings.sent1: The math problem was so strenuous that it took hours to solve.
meanings.sent2: The negotiations between the two countries were a strenuous process.
meanings.sent3: Trying to teach a cat to fetch proved to be a strenuous endeavor.
meanings.sent4: The detective faced a strenuous investigation to solve the mysterious case.
meanings.sent5: The chef's signature dish was a strenuous recipe that required precise timing.
